item.title: FFA-201: AI Fundamentals for Non-Technical Personnel
item.description:
FFA-201

AI Fundamentals for Non-Technical Personnel

Executive overview of artificial intelligence and machine learning for commanders, staff officers, and decision-makers. No technical background required—focused on operational implications, capabilities, and limitations.

Program Overview

This program provides non-technical personnel with practical understanding of AI/ML technologies as they apply to UAS operations and military applications. Focus on informed decision-making, not engineering implementation.

Key Focus Areas:

  • AI/ML capabilities and limitations in operational contexts
  • Autonomous systems and human-in-the-loop control
  • Edge computing and tactical AI deployment
  • Ethical considerations and legal frameworks
  • Risk assessment and validation approaches

Who Should Attend

Primary Audience:

item.title: FFA-401: Operational Edge Computing for UAS
item.description:
FFA-401

Operational Edge Computing for UAS

Deploy AI and machine learning at the tactical edge. Develop capability to process sensor data locally, make autonomous decisions, and operate effectively in disconnected environments without cloud connectivity.

Program Overview

This program develops practical edge computing skills for UAS operators. Training emphasizes deployable AI systems that operate in bandwidth-constrained, disconnected operational environments.

Key Focus Areas:

  • Edge computing hardware (Jetson Nano/Xavier, similar platforms)
  • Computer vision and object detection (YOLO, similar frameworks)
  • Real-time target recognition and tracking
  • Autonomous decision-making at the edge
  • Mission-specific AI model deployment

Who Should Attend

Primary Audience:

item.title: FFA-501: Advanced Autonomy Employment & Mission Planning
item.description:
FFA-501

Advanced Autonomy Employment & Mission Planning

Complex autonomous missions and multi-aircraft coordination. Advanced ArduPilot/PX4 configuration for BVLOS operations, coordinated swarms, and sophisticated mission profiles.

Program Overview

This program develops advanced autonomy employment skills for complex operational scenarios. Training covers mission planning, multi-aircraft coordination, and autonomous operations beyond visual line of sight.

Key Focus Areas:

  • ArduPilot/PX4 advanced configuration
  • Complex waypoint missions and conditional logic
  • Multi-aircraft coordination and deconfliction
  • BVLOS operations planning and execution
  • Autonomous swarm behaviors
  • Degraded autonomy contingency planning

Who Should Attend

Primary Audience:

item.title: FFF-201: Electronics Repair for Deployed Operators
item.description:
FFF-201

Electronics Repair for Deployed Operators

Field-level electronics repair without bench equipment. Develop capability to diagnose, repair, and sustain UAS electronics in austere operational environments.

Program Overview

This program develops practical electronics repair skills for field conditions. Training emphasizes rapid diagnosis and repair without extensive lab equipment—maintaining operational readiness with minimal supply chain support.

Key Focus Areas:

  • Soldering and desoldering techniques
  • Component-level troubleshooting and diagnosis
  • Motor, ESC, and flight controller repair
  • Sensor and camera system repair
  • Power system diagnostics
  • Field-expedient repair techniques

Who Should Attend

Primary Audience:

item.title: FFF-301: Additive Manufacturing for UAS Sustainment
item.description:
FFF-301

Additive Manufacturing for UAS Sustainment

3D printing for field manufacturing of replacement parts. Develop capability to design, print, and deploy structural components in forward locations—reducing dependency on traditional supply chains.

Program Overview

This program develops practical additive manufacturing skills for UAS sustainment. Training emphasizes rapid part replacement, not aerospace-grade production. Focus on keeping platforms operational with field-manufactured components.

Key Focus Areas:

  • FDM/FFF 3D printing fundamentals
  • Material selection for UAS applications (LW-PLA, PETG, others)
  • Design for printability and rapid iteration
  • Field printing in austere environments
  • Structural component fabrication
  • Testing and validation of printed parts

Who Should Attend

Primary Audience:

item.title: FFF-401: Advanced FPV Systems Integration & Field Sustainment
item.description:
FFF-401

FLAGSHIP PROGRAM

Transform personnel with zero FPV experience into operationally proficient pilots. This comprehensive program addresses the critical capability gap: units needing rapid FPV deployment without lengthy training pipelines or contractor dependency.

Program Overview

This intensive training program covers complete aircraft assembly, flight controller configuration, progressive flight training, and tactical mission execution. Based on Army UALC standards and Ukrainian operational lessons learned.

Key Focus Areas:

  • Complete FPV system assembly from components
  • Flight controller configuration and tuning
  • Intensive simulator and progressive live flight training
  • Tactical mission execution and ISR coordination
  • Field sustainment and repair capabilities

Who Should Attend

Primary Audience:

item.title: FFF-402: FPV Master Trainer Certification
item.description:
FFF-402

FPV Master Trainer Certification

Become a certified FPV instructor. Train-the-trainer program for organizations establishing sustainable internal training capability without perpetual dependence on commercial training providers.

Program Overview

This program qualifies experienced operators to train others to FPV Tactical Operator Level 1 standards. Training covers instructional methodology, curriculum delivery, safety management, and student assessment.

Key Focus Areas:

  • Instructional methodology and adult learning principles
  • Curriculum structure and lesson planning
  • Student assessment and proficiency evaluation
  • Safety management and risk mitigation
  • Training documentation and standards maintenance
  • Quality assurance and instructor certification

Who Should Attend

Primary Audience:

item.title: FFR-101: RF Awareness for Non-Technical Personnel
item.description:
FFR-101

RF Awareness for Non-Technical Personnel

Executive overview of RF and electronic warfare for commanders, staff officers, and decision-makers. No technical background required—focused on operational implications and coordination requirements.

Program Overview

This program provides non-technical personnel with practical understanding of RF spectrum operations and electronic warfare as they impact UAS operations. Focus on informed decision-making and coordination—not engineering implementation.

Key Focus Areas:

  • RF spectrum fundamentals and allocation
  • Electronic warfare threat overview
  • GPS dependency and alternatives
  • UAS vulnerability to EW threats
  • Coordination with electromagnetic warfare officers (S-6/G-6)
  • Operational planning considerations

Who Should Attend

Primary Audience:

item.title: FFR-201: Tactical RF Fundamentals for UAS Operators
item.description:
FFR-201

Tactical RF Fundamentals for UAS Operators

Address the most lethal capability gap: operators who cannot diagnose and overcome electronic warfare threats in real-time. Based on Ukrainian combat lessons learned and operational requirements in contested electromagnetic environments.

Program Overview

This program develops spectrum awareness and RF diagnostic capabilities for UAS operators. Training focuses on understanding communications as contested, fragile dependencies and developing the ability to recognize and respond when the spectrum is degraded or denied.

item.title: FFR-301: Advanced Electronic Warfare for UAS Operations
item.description:
FFR-301

Advanced Electronic Warfare for UAS Operations

Advanced EW countermeasures and spectrum operations planning. Integration with unit electromagnetic warfare officers and sophisticated counter-EW tactics for contested operational environments.

Program Overview

This program develops advanced electronic warfare capabilities for UAS operations. Training covers sophisticated countermeasures, spectrum deconfliction, and coordination with S-6/G-6 electromagnetic warfare elements.

Key Focus Areas:

  • Advanced jamming countermeasures
  • Spectrum operations planning and coordination
  • Counter-UAS tactics and techniques
  • SIGINT and communications intelligence
  • Integration with electromagnetic warfare officers
  • Operational security in contested spectrum

Who Should Attend

Primary Audience:
